interestingFact: India is home to the ancient Indus Valley Civilization and has the world's largest postal network. It also celebrates more festivals than any other country in the world.
The world has approximately 7.9 billion people and 71% of its surface is covered by water, most of which is found in oceans.
Nepal is the only country in the world without a rectangular flag, and it was never colonized by a foreign power.
Egyptians invented the 365-day calendar to predict the annual flooding of the Nile River, which was vital for agriculture.
Australia has more kangaroos than people and is the only country that occupies an entire continent.
Brazil is known for its vibrant Carnival festival and is the largest coffee producer in the world.
France is the most visited country in the world, attracting around 90 million tourists annually.
Russia has the world's deepest lake, Lake Baikal, which contains about 20% of the planet's unfrozen freshwater.
China has the world's largest high-speed rail network, spanning over 42,000 kilometers, and the Terracotta Army consists of more than 8,000 life-sized statues.
